key_insight: Prune irrelevant visual tokens from SAM2 using text-driven relevance signals so temporal reasoning only processes task-relevant tokens, dramatically reducing compute and memory without sacrificing segmentation quality.
problem_solved: SAM2 processes dense visual tokens across time, causing high computational and memory cost (poor scalability) when applying prompt-driven video object segmentation.
method: Use text prompts to compute per-token relevance scores and identify tokens related to the target object.
Dynamically prune low-relevance tokens before temporal reasoning modules, propagating only the compact set of informative tokens across frames.
Keep the segmentation pipeline intact so pruning reduces workload while preserving downstream accuracy.
impact: Makes SAM2-based video object segmentation far more practical for large-scale, real-time, and edge deployments by lowering compute and memory requirements while retaining task performance.
